intro: Draba cayouettei, commonly known as the Cayouette's whitlow grass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, followed by seed pods that mature in summer. Draba cayouettei is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions.
